content.description: The figures represent different ways of configuring a network of physically linked computers labeled P, Q, R, and S. A line between two computers indicates that the computers can communicate directly with each other.
content.question: In which configuration is it NOT possible to have redundant routing between computers P and S?

choices.label: The figure shows a network of physically linked computers labeled P through S. Computer P is connected to computers Q and R. Computer Q is connected to computers P and S. Computer R is connected to computers P and S. Computer S is connected to computers Q and R.

The figure shows a network of physically linked computers labeled P through S. Computer P is connected to computer R. Computer Q is connected to computers R and S. Computer R is connected to computers P and Q. Computer S is connected to computer Q.

The figure shows a network of physically linked computers labeled P through S. Computer P is connected to computers Q, R, and S. Computer Q is connected to computers P and S. Computer R is connected to computer P. Computer S is connected to computers P and Q.

The figure shows a network of physically linked computers labeled P through S. Computer P is connected to computers Q and R. Computer Q is connected to computers P, R, and S. Computer R is connected to computers P, Q, and S. Computer S is connected to computers Q and R.

content.answer: The figure shows a network of physically linked computers labeled P through S. Computer P is connected to computer R. Computer Q is connected to computers R and S. Computer R is connected to computers P and Q. Computer S is connected to computer Q.
